title: Nice place to capture sunset photo
review: Short walk from our hotel. Could be a beautiful place, unfortunately riddled with rubbish and debris. Which is a shame as there is an entry fee. Got some nice photos with camera and mobile phone.

title: OUTSIDE VIEW
review: its same from all the angles and all are same type monuments..

title: Photographic location
review: A very good photographic location. Very close to Jaisalmer city. There is an entry fee for tourists i.e ₹100/- charge for per person and ₹100/-  for camera. This place is a burial ground of kings of Jaisalmer so worth a visit if you are interested in history.

title: Similar to Badabaag
review: Beautiful but not beautiful like badabaag they charge unnecessary ticket for small visit .. but can visit for some good picture

title: Scenic
review: The view is made for photos, great memories and built in many years back. Many people use to visit and we took many pictures too.

title: Vyas Chhatri
review: Vyas Chhatri is also a historic place in jaisalmer. you have to pay for entry. photogenic place. if you have time then you can visit otherwise skip this place

title: Sunset spot
review: It is not necessary to go far to enjoy beautiful cenotaphs at sunset

title: Sun Set from Vyas Chhatri
review: An awesome place to watch sunset and doing photography. From Jaisalmer fort it's just 1 km. Must visit place .

title: photographer's dream
review: gorgeous detail work in sandstone, rows of beautiful chhatris. no crowd, easy to access. and easy to take pictures in beautiful settings.

title: Nothing much
review: There is nothing much exciting about this place place is located out side of the city and you can have best sunset of the year here. Photographers place.Burial place of all the maharajas and their wives.

title: Serene, Sandy, Photogenic Cenotaphs
review: This one's at Bada Bagh. Watch the sunset here. Be prepared to be bothered by little punks there for some money. You may give them something if you feel generous. Otherwise, be an ignorant bast*rd like me and let them screw with you untill they get tired and walk off.

title: Sunset Point
review: This place is very similar to Bada Bagh, where cenotaph was built on a small hillock. This place is great for sunset view.

title: Cenopaths of the former kings
review: This was one of the stops on our way out to do a Camel Safari - we were there in end of March when it was scorching hot so no one else was around - it was wonderful to get to see the place ot ourselves and spend time looking at difference in the styles as the time progressed.

title: Photo-stop and nothing else!
review: This place is still used as a crematorium. Though many people suggest that you can go here for the sunset I would say there are much better places in Jaisalmer to view the sunset!Though it's a nice place to click pics but can easily be avoided as it's quite similar to Bada Bagh!

title: 15-30min picture opportunity
review: Just outside the city this place is calmly placed on a mountain top overseeing a valley. We came before sundown, enjoyed the quiet atmosphere and took a few photos. Entrance was something around 100 p.P.. Btw, you definitely don’t need a guide on site to enjoy it.

title: Good place for sunset and view over Jaisalmer
review: Great vantage point to see a good sunset with the city down in the valley below and the fort towering above it. The Cenotaphs of the Kings are quite striking

title: Dont waste you money on this
review: We reached the spot but after learning that there is an entry fee of Rs. 100 per visitor. we decides to skip the spot. Its not worth the money. Instead, I used a high zoom camera to capture the site right from the entry point. This place can simple be skipped as there is no activity there and entry fee is exorbitant for the experience it offers. Avoid.

title: Waste of time & entry fees
review: Its burial grounds of kings which is managed by the royal family of Jaisalmer. The place has an entry fee of INR 100 / pax with additional fee of 100 for camera( including mobile camera).

title: Good place to visit for photography only otherwise JUNK
review: -> If you are a sunset capturing photographer or fort night view capturing photographer or like to capture architecture ,hit this place, otherwise it is just a creamtion ground , nothing else .

title: Photo stop only
review: From Jaisalmer city 5-6km this place is situated. For tourists ₹100/- charge for per person and for photo shoot or camera  you should pay ₹100/- you can good photo view only nothing else.

title: nice place
review: nice place to visit well maintained by local goverment. must see point during visit to jaisalmer  !!!!!!!

title: Entry was closed
review: Lots of  chhatris of different sizes but entry was closed. We could see only from outside the gate. Not many people visit this place.

title: Beautyfull historical monuments
review: A beautiful example of Rajasthani architecture, Vyas Chhatri as the name suggests, is dedicated to sage Vyaas, the writer of the epic Mahabharata. This local version of a cenotaph, is made up of delicate carvings that are a sight to behold.

title: Nice
review: Did not entered inside as was closed. From a distance the architecture looked good, nice quite place and detour to Sam.

title: Underwhelmed
review: I have to admit that I didn't realise this was still an active cremation site! The old memorials are picturesque and there are views over the city but there are better places to watch the sun set.

title: Good place
review: A beautiful example of Rajasthani architecture, and give a great view and the name is kept on something local

title: Splendid Sunset spot
review: I will remember this place not just for the stunning architectural splendour. I remember the sense of peace and tranquillity away from the city. The sounds of rural life, crops being harvested, people taking time to relax. And my only experience of hearing a peacock.

title: Big umbrella structure, typical of Rajasthani architecture
review: Built right in the middle of the desert, the chhatri is dedicated to sage Vyas. One of the best places in Jaisalmer for a sunset view.

title: Just for photos
review: Another site which can be used as backdrops for clicking pics. Can be easily avoided. There are better things to visit in Jaisalmer

title: Vayas chhatri
review: This place is where cenotaphs are made for the Brahmins. Since it is situated on a small hillock you get open to desert view towards West which is why this is an excellent place for enjoying sunsets.

title: Old cenotaphs -- but visit only if you have time
review: The cenotaphs at Vyas Chhatri are ok. Since Jaisalmer's density is low, this place seems to be on the outskirts, on the way to Sam. You can see them from the road as well. You should visit only if you have time and are in Jaisalmer for a long visit (i.e. you have time to spend at 'all' the attractions). Bada Bagh is much more famous and beautiful -- if you have to choose, pick Bada Bagh for a cenotaph visit and get a glimpse of the history.

title: Amazing Cenatophes...
review: Not new but first time to see many cenatophes together. In Bollywood movies we have seen these Cenatophes 100 times. it looks pretty.

title: Burial Place for Brahmins.Desolate and unmanned
review: A buriary l place for wealthy Brahmins.Poorly Maintained. 10 minutes for a lookin. Not worth the entry fee

title: Must visit for a while.
review: Sunset times are gorgeous. Amazing place to be. Architecture very fine. Shooting site of the movie Kacche Dhaage bollywood..

title: The gate was closed
review: When i visit this place, the gate was closed. There was nobody to tell me the reason. However, i was able to see the structure inside. There was nothing special inside.

title: Vyas Chhatri
review: Vyas Chhatri is also a very good place and attraction of tourist for sightseeing in jaisalmer. construction of Vyas Chhatri is so beautiful and famous spot for history lover.

title: Sunset Point!
review: There is not much at this place. Though its renowned as the sunset point in Jaisalmer, I couldn't find anything special there. Even the sunset view wasn't something to boast about. Also, you won't find any public transport for return journey. You would need to walk around 1 km before you could get an auto.

title: Amazing
review: This is the most amazing place I had ever visit. It is hard to believe there is such a scene in the whole world. It is like a mirage in the desert.

title: same cenotaphs
review: same cenotaphs.jus a photographic spot for photo buffs.good sunset and sunrise views.if you have time to spend then go.

title: a much hype attraction..
review: Its an old cemetery for brahmans.. not sure why it is so popular.. nothing special.. if you visited bada bagh then you can skip this.. I visited this place during morning walk.. didn't found worthful for spending time..

title: Nice sunset but without fort
review: The archi is nice esp agst the nice blue sky. Not the typicaly sunset point w fort in the background but the view of the sun fr here is superd!

title: Unexciting
review: Interesting architecture; golden sandstone chhatris / cremation monuments. Nothing else to see. Would recommend as a good place to watch the sunset, otherwise from fort. Only recommend if you have a lot of spare time in Jaisalmer and have already gone to the fort and had a "safari" in the desert.

title: This is a burial ground in daily use.
review: Who has listed this place as a tourist spot? It is a in use burial ground with a few Chhatries. What a waste of time.

title: Sunset Point
review: Excellent place to be at for the sunset. Gives a clear view of the sunset. Also one can find the sandstones that make Jaisalmer the golden city.

title: perfect spot for sunset
review: Me and my friend went there for sunset and it was fantastic. It is perfect and quite place were you can have an amazing sunset. It is only 10 minutes with rickshaw and it is worth. I would highly recommend to everyone! enjoy

title: Go for Sunset
review: I stayed very close to this place and went there for Sunset and clicked some nice pictures. I suppose places like these are built recently just to attract tourists. No need to plan to this place. Just ask for any auto guy and he will take you there. Better go during Sunset. Keep a bottle with you as there is nothing close to this place.

title: As name suggests Its cemetry of "Vyas"ji.
review: Its cemetery of "Vyas", who wrote one of big epic story "mahabharat". Also sunset view is good from this location.

title: Hauntingly Beautiful Place
review: A few minutes rickshaw ride from the fort (have your driver wait, not so many rickshaws there), it is a gorgeous place with a wonderful view of the fort. A tangle of golden cenotaphs, and the Brahmin burning ground. Completely worth the visit. We went for a spectacular sunset.

title: Awesome Sunset
review: Awesome Sunset among the remains of an old Cenotaph. Prepare your camera! And arrive early prior to the sunset hour to find a good spot to enjoy!

title: Having some history
review: Go only if you are having time, i don't like the place not worth to go. so you decide. if you go there then take one guide there.

title: Right palace to make nice pic. with sun set.
review: This is excellent palace in Rajasthan to make  nice and  excellent  pic. where you can spend  more  then  2 hours

title: First ever chhatris of brahmins & the best sunset point.
review: i visited this chhatris & sunset point at the recommendations of mahindra resorts. i paid fee for camera.After reaching the chhatries i realised that these chhatries were built for the brahmins & this was not of the royal families.From here one can see the best sunset view in the whole of jaisalmer.

title: Vyas Chhatri
review: A must see visit to VYAS CHHATRI. You will visit a cenotaph of the people of Rajastan of the past. Seeing how other religions vererate their dear is very educational.

title: Architecture only
review: Excellent architecture of Rajathani culture...  well maintained by royal families. look at architecture, nothing more to enjoy...

title: excellent views of sunset and fort in the distance
review: The monuments were all very impressive and one can take some excellent pictures here, particularly at sunset when the sunlight matches the golden colored stones. One can also see the golden fort in the distance.

title: Golden Sandstone Chhatris
review: Excellent sunset viewpoint, the Jaisalmer fort can also be seen from here, the golden sandstone chhatris, the various cenotaphs are a must visit place in Jaisalmer. This is an active cremation site.

title: Excellent Architecture
review: Excellent architecture  made out of yellow stone, this place is good to watch sunset. nothing else to see there

title: sunset point
review: one of the point from where you can take few pics if you love to take pictures. good place for the photographers in a rainy day

title: A place for sunset
review: Our driver suggested this as the place for sunset. We arrived in time to walk among the cenotaphs and find the place to sit and watch sunset. It's only a short drive out of Jaiselmer, past the place where the tour buses stop for sunset views. Very few tourists there with us.

title: A deserted place
review: Vyas Chhatri is just like Bada Bagh, in a much smaller version. This place comes on the way to Bada Bagh at a distance of 3 kms approx. At present this is closed and there is no entry permitted. But you can see this from outside (basically on your way to Bada Bagh). This is not a must watch, can be skipped.

title: Good place to enjoy sunset,
review: This is a better place compared to the Bada Bagh if you want to enjoy sunset and do some good sunset photography. This is at the edge of the town, hence you do not need to go another six kilometers. This is the cenotaphs of Bramhins and looks quite similar to Bada Bagh cenotaphs.

title: It is a memorial and cremation ground
review: I do not know why people visit this place and they even have an entry ticket of 50 rs. for a cremation ground... Funny... well i visited no 1 was there got scared and came back, could see burnt ash of some burnt last night only... Avoid visiting a few km ahead is bada bagh do visit that...

title: Sunset point
review: Gothere in the evening around 5.30 or so, and see the old marvel, the chhatris, look good from a distance, unnecessary entry fee of Rs.30/ is charged here, dont find any rationale for that. However the sunset lloks good, as it looks from any other point from Jaisalmer ot the sand dunes, still worth one look when in Jaisalmer.

title: How can a Cremation ground be tourist attraction?
review: How the hell can a Cremation ground be attraction? I don't know why it is even listed in place to see in Jaisalmer. It is an active cremation ground fro Brahmins where dead body still gets cremated. It is adjacent to a muslim graveyard. Some canopies are constructed to remember the dead ones but that does not make it a tourist attraction. Stay away from this place as there are several other good places to see in Jaisalmer. Please do not include a place in tourist map just to increase number of tourist spots

title: A bigger version of Bada Bagh
review: You will be surprised to see its just a bigger version of Bada Bagh. Just more numbers of Cenotaphs. A good time to go there is during the evening so that you can see the sunset. You can also get a good view of windmills spread across adjoining areas of jaisalmer. In all the places in Jaisalmer, Rs. 50 is charged for camera be it DSLR, point and shoot or mobile one. You can avoid it as there is nothing great about it. Please read about the place before visiting it.

title: should not have been listed in attraction!
review: First of all, this is still an active cremation site. Secondly, there are entry charges (no where in the country, an active cremation site charges money!) even camera is charged for! Thirdly, this site has nothing special. There are better sites for sunset and sunrise! Also, please note that this place doesn't open up early in the morning not even around 8-8.30., so people looking forward at sunrise can best avoid this place.Bada Bagh is more famous with better chhatris although they lack care and some are damaged.

title: Awesome sunset
review: Constructed a little far away from the human settlement, this place has an amazing sunset. The color of the structures gels so well with the dawning sun, that it makes everything look like pure gold.

title: tombs of the unknown
review: the small chattaris made in the area from the same golden stone are beautifully carved.They depict the tomb of the ancestors of the given local community.Enchanting view at sunset.must see

title: Look Out for the Photo Enthusiasts, but don't miss
review: Well, what sunsets... beautiful, serene and truly 'Indian' in their construct - you can see why this location is a favourite amongst the serious and amateur photographers

title: Gorgeous Sunset
review: We went here at the recommendation of our Hotel for the best sunset view in jaisalmer and we had exactly the same kind of experience! The place was crowded with travellers waiting for the sunset moments and we got a vantage point looking at the Sun go down in amazing light! The place is well maintained and deserves a visit!

title: Different than other cenotaphs
review: These cenotaphs are built for the Brahmin community of Jaisalmer.  The memorial slabs depict winged angels.  It is noteworthy as such symbols are never used for Hindu shrines.  The place leaves you with a melancholy feeling though.  A stop for 30 minutes is enough.

title: Good spot for photography and Sunset
review: To reach here you have to brace yourself for a bit of travel as it’s quite far from the city itself and requires a bit of extensive travel. Our guide was very excited about this place for he told that this place could be our “the spot” for photography and he was absolutely true in that regards and I would suggest those who are heading the place for this particular reason to actually wait for the sunset when the whole place gets perfect for photography with perfect color and lighting all around. I was very impressed with the whole structures and the photos that came out from here. The place actually was or is a cremation place and the unique structure that we see here is actually cenotaphs that are placed in the memories of the royals that used to rule jaisalmer. The place is less crowded and even the touts are less in numbers as compared to any other places in the city or India for that matter

title: Nice Location to view Sunset
review: A great place to enjoy sunset view from city. Also known as Sunset point. A miracle sunset view from this point are really great.

title: Oh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: I thought something connected with Vyas Maharshi

title: Sunset spot
review: Awesome place to spend your evening and definitely "the spot" for the photographers.

title: i just wanted to cuddle her
review: True Indian food, cooked in Vyas house, you sit in her home, whilst she cooks next to you. Somehow we managed to communicate, although we know no Hindi, and Vyas, little English, this was no problem, and our welcome was heartfelt.  The food was cooked right infront of you, a great experience, and a lovely old lady.

title: Perfect romantic place
review: Spent quite a few evenings and mornings here on my last visit. The place is both haunting and romantic, provides perfect mood to spend time with a partner, or yourself, and excellent for photography too.

title: Beautiful for the camera
review: The place is great to be visited in late when the light around the place is beautiful with the sun stroking the entire mausoleum and giving the place almost a golden colour. Apart from the golden lighting and beautiful view to capture on camera, the place has nothing much to offer and on top of that the place is a bit outside of the town, though  easy to reach.

title: Beautiful view
review: we been there in the evening and it was a great site. We had our guide and he explained us about this site. We enjoyed our time there.

title: Excellent Sunset View
review: The place is Awesome place to sit and watch the sun going down.  Definitely "the spot" for the photographers and sunset lovers. The Cenotaphs though were not well maintained.

title: lovely cenotaphs
review: A very pretty place with lots of lovely cenotaphs.Burial place of all the maharajas and their wives.Very photogenic,shame about the windmills but needs must!

title: One of the Best Sunset
review: place is located out side of the city and you can have best sunset of the year here. Photographers place. Must visit.

title: Nice place to go in the late afternoon
review: I went to this place in the late afternoon. Light is beautiful at that time of the day, giving the place almost a golden colour. Sunset was not that special. Place is a bit outside tiwn, but still easy to reach.

title: Hisoirical place but away from city
review: THis site is afr away from jaisalmer city and it looks lioke umbrella like small constructions build by old maharajas ( KIngs) to remember them,its like cementry or Samadhi of Hindus .when king dies he creamited and than build such place to rememb er him

title: Beautiful!
review: Vyas Chhatari is a beautiful place to go at sunset. Although the scenery has slightly been spoiled by wind turbines in recent years it is still very much worth a visit. Most importantly, I would recommend going in the afternoon as you will have more chance of meeting Rahul. Rahul is by far the friendliest person we met in Jaisalmer and was a great tour guide. He is very bright, completely self taught and it was a pleasure to meet him. Keep an eye out for him!

title: its a crematorium!!!
review: I went there at around 6 30 in the evening, walking from hanuman circle. It is a 15 min walk. On reaching there it was very quiet with only a few vendors at the gate. It is actually a shamshan bhoomi for the Brahman people of Jaisalmer. From the entrance about 400 mts inside you will be able to see chatris where the people in the olden times were cremated. Slightly scary place in the evening time, but it is open only in the evening as it is also viewed as a sunset point.

title: Nice
review: Did not entered inside as was closed. From a distance the architecture looked good, nice quite place and detour to Sam.

title: ok place
review: There is nothing exciting about this place and if you go there make sure you have vehicle as in the evening your travel options back to city are limited, if you are interested in photography make sure you visit there in the evening the sunset is pretty good over here and adds to the colours of Chatri

title: Famous for sunset
review: This place is where cenotaphs are made for the Brahmins. Since it is situated on a small hillock you get open to desert view towards West which is why this is an excellent place for enjoying sunsets.

title: Peaceful
review: Went early in the morning before heading to Bikaner.  It's worth a 15 minute visit but it's not well maintained.

title: Perfect place for Evening in Jaisalmer.,
review: Another perfect place in Jaisalmer for well spend evening.. just 10-15 closer place from anywhere in Jaisalmer ..

title: The memorial of Vyas community
review: It is after all a memorial for the Vyas community,but the chhatris(umbrella shaped structures) are a delight.It is said that every grandson before his marriage,build the memorial of his grandfather by constructing a chhatri.Two distinct architectural styles-Hindu and Islamic are visible.Young boys are available to offer their services as guides and are recommended.

title: Nice place to capture sunset photo
review: Short walk from our hotel. Could be a beautiful place, unfortunately riddled with rubbish and debris. Which is a shame as there is an entry fee. Got some nice photos with camera and mobile phone.

title: Nice at Sunset
review: The memorials themselves are slightly interesting--more interesting is the location just on the edge of the old city on a hill with a beautiful view to the west and to the east.  Sort of a photographer's delight.  There are plenty of places to sit and enjoy the view too.

title: Photographic location
review: A very good photographic location. Very close to Jaisalmer city. There is an entry fee for tourists i.e ₹100/- charge for per person and ₹100/-  for camera. This place is a burial ground of kings of Jaisalmer so worth a visit if you are interested in history.

title: OUTSIDE VIEW
review: its same from all the angles and all are same type monuments..

title: Similar to Badabaag
review: Beautiful but not beautiful like badabaag they charge unnecessary ticket for small visit .. but can visit for some good picture

title: Scenic
review: The view is made for photos, great memories and built in many years back. Many people use to visit and we took many pictures too.

title: Vyas Chhatri
review: Vyas Chhatri is also a historic place in jaisalmer. you have to pay for entry. photogenic place. if you have time then you can visit otherwise skip this place

title: Sunset spot
review: It is not necessary to go far to enjoy beautiful cenotaphs at sunset

title: photographer's dream
review: gorgeous detail work in sandstone, rows of beautiful chhatris. no crowd, easy to access. and easy to take pictures in beautiful settings.

title: Sun Set from Vyas Chhatri
review: An awesome place to watch sunset and doing photography. From Jaisalmer fort it's just 1 km. Must visit place .

title: Nothing much
review: There is nothing much exciting about this place place is located out side of the city and you can have best sunset of the year here. Photographers place.Burial place of all the maharajas and their wives.

title: Nice place to capture sunset photo
review: Short walk from our hotel. Could be a beautiful place, unfortunately riddled with rubbish and debris. Which is a shame as there is an entry fee. Got some nice photos with camera and mobile phone.

review: its same from all the angles and all are same type monuments..

title: photographer's dream
review: gorgeous detail work in sandstone, rows of beautiful chhatris. no crowd, easy to access. and easy to take pictures in beautiful settings.

title: Vyas Chhatri
review: Vyas Chhatri is also a historic place in jaisalmer. you have to pay for entry. photogenic place. if you have time then you can visit otherwise skip this place

title: Nothing much
review: There is nothing much exciting about this place place is located out side of the city and you can have best sunset of the year here. Photographers place.Burial place of all the maharajas and their wives.
